awd_titl_txt: The Geochemistry of Uranium in Marine Sediments and SedimentPore Waters
awd_abstract_narration: This is a study of uranium geochemistry in the anoxic                      sediments of the Black Sea.  The investigator is studying the                   mechanism by which uranium is precipitated from seawater.                       Experiments are designed to determine the relative role of                      organic complexation and the reduction of u+6 to U+4 in the                     precipitation process.  The Black Sea serves as a ready made                    laboratory where the uranium in seawater has already been                       reduced to the +4 state before it diffuses into the sediments.                  The samples were collected during the Black Sea expedition                      (April-July, 1988) and in this project they will be analyzed                    and interpreted.  The ultimate goal of the research is to                       understand the sources and the sinks of uranium in seawater.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION FOR THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK
